MISR Terminology
MISR Terminology

• MISR orbits the earth 15 times/day.
• MISR orbits the earth 15 times/day. • M I S R
o r b i t s t h e
e a r t h
1 5
t i m e s / d a y .

• Orbit numbers indicate the number of revolutions since launch.
• Orbit numbers indicate the number of revolutions since launch. • O r b i t n u m b e r s
i n d i c a t e
t h e
n u m b e r
o f
r e v o l u t i o n s
s i n c e
l a u n c h .

• 233 distinct orbit paths repeated every 16 days.
• 233 distinct orbit paths repeated every 16 days. • 2 3 3

o r b i t
p a t h s r e p e a t e d
e v e r y

d a y s .

• Each of these 16 days is referred to as a Data Day.
• Each of these 16 days is referred to as a Data Day. • E a c h

d a y s

t o

• The 233 repeating orbits are called paths.
• The 233 repeating orbits are called paths. • T h e

a r e

p a t h s .

• Paths overlap allowing near global coverage in 9 days.
